mystery_intro: ^You step into your backyard early in the morning and the sun just peeking over the fence.
^You walk over to your tomato plant and notice one of the biggest tomatoes you were planning to pick is gone.
^You look around the garden to see if you can figure out what happened.

s: ^Check around the tomato plant for clues.
^Ignore it and get on with gardening.

investigate_scene: ^You kneel by the plant and notice the soil’s a bit messy. There are tiny tracks leading away.

s: ^Probably a squirrel. They’re always running along the fence.
^Maybe the neighbor’s dog that likes to dig around.
^Maybe it just fell off and rolled somewhere.

suspect_squirrel: ^You decide to set up a little motion camera overnight, just to see what’s going on.
^Sure enough, the next morning you catch a squirrel on camera running off with another tomato.
^Guess it’s time to set up some netting around the plant.
suspect_pet: ^You ask your neighbor if their dog has been out and about lately.
^They admit she sneaks around sometimes and digs for fun.
^Time to set up a small fence around your garden.
suspect_natural: ^You check around some bushes nearby and find your tomato. It is kinda squished and probably rolled off in the wind.
^At least no one stole it. Still, now you want to grow even more.
garden_intro: ^With the mystery sort of solved, you turn your attention to the fun part.
^Today’s the day. You’re finally starting your garden for real after having so much fun experimenting with tomatoes. The yard's open and waiting to grow something awesome.
^What kind of garden do you want to build?

s: ^A veggie garden for fresh stuff I can eat.
^A flower garden for the cool colors and good vibes.
^A succulent setup that is low maintenance and good for beginners.

veggie_start: ^You decide to go with vegetables. You grab your tools and start sketching out where everything will go.

s: ^Tomatoes. They turned out good on your initial attempt.
^Lettuce. Quick and easy greens sound great.

plant_tomatoes: ^You plant some tomato seedlings and give them some water. They love the sun, so you make sure they’re in the best spot.
^A few weeks go by and you start seeing little green tomatoes. But… the leaves have some spots.

s: ^Look up a fix and try to treat them.
^See if the plant can handle it on its own.

treat_tomatoes: ^You get some neem plant spray, trim the bad leaves, and check on them every day.
^It works and by the end of summer, you’re picking big, juicy tomatoes. Enjoy!
ignore_tomatoes: ^Turns out those spots were bad news and the plant slowly droops and shrivels up.
^Next time, you’ll jump on that faster.
plant_lettuce: ^Lettuce grows super fast, and after a couple of weeks, you’ve got little leafy sprouts popping up.
^Then you notice a sneaky rabbit eating your lettuce.

s: ^Put up a fence to keep it out.
^Let it nibble since you want to help the rabbit.

fence_rabbit: ^You build a little fence around the lettuce patch and it works like a charm.
^The rabbit moves on, and you get to enjoy your homegrown greens.
share_with_rabbit: ^You decide to let the rabbit snack a little. The lettuce never really grows big, but you don’t mind.
^You enjoy having a little garden buddy.
flower_start: ^You head to the garden center and grab a bunch of bright, cheerful flowers.

s: ^In neat little rows by the fence.
^Just scatter them around and let them do their thing.

fence_flowers: ^You line up the tulips and lilies in clean rows.
^Your neighbors are impressed when they see your garden which feels good.
wild_flowers: ^You go all in and plant the flowers everywhere with no pattern.
^You enjoy the random nature vibe it brings with different colors everywhere.
succulent_start: ^Succulents are easy and cool looking, so you grab a few little pots and some soil.
aloe_choice: ^You place the aloe by the window and it starts thriving. Later, you get a sunburn and remember you’ve got aloe right there.
^It ended up being more than just a nice decoration.
echeveria_choice: ^You arrange the echeveria in a cute little pattern and post a picture to your social media.
^Your friends love it and ask if you can design them an arrangement.
